p: In the Probate Court of Whitman County W.T.
In the matter of the adoption of Daisy Geneva Departes a minor

N.P. Hateley being duly sworn on oath that he is acquainted with Amos Gustin and Elizabeth Departes Catherine Gustin that said Amos Gustin is the owner of a fram in Nez Perce County Idaho Territory and has been for the past five years or there about wishing thereon with his farm and has been until the past week been resident of said Idaho Territory and affiduty believes that said Amost Gustin above from Idaho Territory is but temporary, if at all, and not for the purpose of changing his residnece to Colfax except for temproary

Affiant further says that in the summer months of 1887, affiant was at the home of said Amos Gustin and Catherine Gustin in Nez Perce County Idaho and in a ernousulim had with said Catherine Gustin, she said that she did not entend to keep the child Daisy Geneva Departes
but would deliever her up to her mother at any time she should desire to take her away
Subscribed & sworn to before me this 25th day of January A.D. 1888
P. Probate Court of Whitman County WT
official clerk of Probate Court for Whitman
